wikipedia_page.main: William Stagg (born 17 October 1957) is an English retired footballer who played as a left winger in the Football League for Brentford. He also played in Sweden and the United States. Stagg's 5 ft 4 in (1.63 m) height ties him with Hughie Reed for the record of shortest Brentford player.

response: Reed joined Fourth Division strugglers Brentford on a one-month loan in October 1973. He played in four league defeats for the Bees and along with Billy Stagg, he holds the record of the shortest player to play for the club.
